questions.text: Which of the following roles and responsibilities should be represented within the review group?
options: Business sponsor – ensures requirements align with business objectives
Business owners – ensure requirements clearly express business needs
Subject Matter Expert (SME) – validates business practice accuracy
Solution architect – ensures alignment with organizational architecture
Project office representatives – ensure compliance with governance
Finance controller – checks project budget accuracy
correctAnswer: Business sponsor – ensures requirements align with business objectives
Business owners – ensure requirements clearly express business needs
Subject Matter Expert (SME) – validates business practice accuracy
Solution architect – ensures alignment with organizational architecture
Project office representatives – ensure compliance with governance
questions.explanation: An effective review group includes all stakeholders involved in validating business, technical, and compliance aspects. Roles like marketing and finance are not typically part of a BRD review.

questions.text: Which of the following correctly describe the three stages of change control?
questions.explanation: Change control involves documenting, analysing, and deciding on proposed changes before implementation. This ensures controlled and traceable adjustments.

questions.text: Which of the following key features do automated support tools provide for managing BRDs or product backlogs?
questions.explanation: Automated tools enhance efficiency and governance by providing traceability, secure storage, versioning, and linkages between related artifacts.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about business requirement documents (BRDs) is TRUE?
options: A BRD defines business needs and high-level requirements
A BRD replaces detailed system specifications
A BRD is primarily a technical design document
A BRD should only be prepared by software developers
questions.correctAnswer: A BRD defines business needs and high-level requirements
questions.explanation: The BRD captures business objectives and high-level requirements; detailed technical design is covered in later documentation.

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of poor requirements that could lead to project issues?
questions.explanation: Requirements should be clear, measurable, and testable. Ambiguity and conflict create confusion and increase project risk.

questions.text: What are the main benefits of conducting a structured review of requirements documents?
options: Identifies issues early in the lifecycle
correctAnswer: Identifies issues early in the lifecycle
questions.explanation: Structured reviews enhance quality and catch defects early, preventing expensive fixes later in development.

questions.text: Which of the following are valid reasons for using configuration management in requirements engineering?
options: To track versions and changes to requirements
To improve communication between team members
correctAnswer: To track versions and changes to requirements
To improve communication between team members
questions.explanation: Configuration management ensures that requirements are versioned, traceable, and controlled, preventing unauthorized or conflicting updates.

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of effective change control practices?
options: Requiring impact analysis for each change request
Allowing developers to change requirements at will
correctAnswer: Requiring impact analysis for each change request
questions.explanation: Proper change control ensures that changes are justified, reviewed, approved, and documented. Uncontrolled changes increase risk.

questions.text: Which of the following benefits can automated requirements tools provide during a review process?
options: Flagging incomplete fields or missing data
Providing review comments and feedback tracking
correctAnswer: Flagging incomplete fields or missing data
Providing review comments and feedback tracking
questions.explanation: Automation aids quality assurance by identifying gaps, tracking review comments, and ensuring completeness and consistency.

questions.text: Why is it important for review group members to represent diverse perspectives within the organization?
options: To ensure all business, technical, and user needs are addressed
To improve collaboration and reduce bias
To ensure every department signs off on every document
correctAnswer: To ensure all business, technical, and user needs are addressed
To improve collaboration and reduce bias
questions.explanation: A diverse review group ensures that requirements are complete, practical, and unbiased by representing multiple stakeholder viewpoints.
